titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A sharp frost last night, followed by a brilliantly fine day. I did not go out on the doctor's advice. M
Ralph Edwards, a journalist, "interviewed" me, and stayed to lunch. Also M
Davies, who bored me to death by his talk about inspecting schools. Finally M
Lloyd, the Master of the endowed school at Staunton–on–Wye, who wants to be ordained. He is rather aggressively Welsh, & would hardly be understood by an English congregation.
